intro: Hieracium choristodon, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy, often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow, forming dense clusters at the top of the stem. Hieracium choristodon is known for its hardy nature and ability to survive in nutrient-poor soils.
